content.question: If <math alttext="y equals, 2 times the natural log of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the fourth derivative of y with respect to x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 12, and denominator x to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 16, and denominator x to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 48, and denominator x to the fifth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>48</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 12, and denominator x to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
